title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost 123-110 to the Orlando Magic, marking their first defeat in the NBA Cup series.
Jaylen Brown scored 32 points, but his 1-for-6 from three-point range limited the Celtics' offensive versatility.
Boston's defense was challenged, allowing 38 and 39 points in the first and fourth quarters, respectively.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for public reprimand for creating appearance of impropriety in 2018 ICE escape case.
Hearing officer Denis J. McInerney found no evidence Joseph authorized the escape of a defendant from ICE.
Federal charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022, but she was investigated by the Massachusetts Commission on Judicial Conduct.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about the team's future despite playoff elimination by the Yankees in October.
Trevor Story opted into his contract, while Alex Bregman opted out; no qualifying offer for pitcher Lucas Giolito.
Rookie Roman Anthony expected to play a significant role as offseason changes loom ahead of opening day 2026.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 75-100 foot blade detached from a wind turbine in Plymouth, Massachusetts, landing in a nearby cranberry bog.
No injuries were reported; the turbine's fail-safe mode activated and the area has been secured by officials.
The incident is under investigation by local authorities, MassDEP, and Inspectional Services to ensure cleanup and safety.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' streaming on Disney+, marks Marvel's Phase 6 with Pedro Pascal, Vanessa Kirby, Joseph Quinn, and Ebon Moss-Bachrach.
'Death by Lightning' highlights James A. Garfield's life and assassination; streaming on Netflix with Michael Shannon and Matthew Macfadyen starring.
'Frankenstein', Guillermo del Toro's adaptation featuring Jacob Elordi and Oscar Isaac, streams on Netflix, presenting a unique take on the classic tale.

title: Stefon Diggs reveals what he’s trying to improve about himself after 11 years in the NFL
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Stefon Diggs aims to improve his attitude, expressing a desire for perfection and balance in his competitiveness.
Diggs leads Patriots receivers in multiple categories, including 508 receiving yards and 45 receptions through nine games.
Diggs credits offensive coaches for creating a supportive environment that encourages player growth and improvement.

title: Commuter train plows through car on tracks in Acton
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A commuter rail train struck an empty car at a Central Street crossing in Acton, officials report no injuries.
The car was reportedly driven around closed gates, leading to the collision with the MBTA train on Thursday.
The incident caused delays on the Fitchburg Line; passengers were advised to take alternate trains.

title: What to know about possible Red Sox free agent target Munetaka Murakami after posting
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Japanese star Munetaka Murakami, 25, has been posted by Tokyo Yakult Swallows, giving him a December 22 MLB signing deadline.
Murakami, a power hitter nicknamed the "Japanese Babe Ruth," hit 56 home runs in 2022 breaking NPB's single-season record.
MLB teams, including the Red Sox, have interest in Murakami; projected signing could reach eight years, $180 million.

title: Airlines are waiving fees, offering refunds due to reduced flight schedules
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Airlines waive fees and offer refunds due to a 10% flight reduction at 40 airports caused by the government shutdown.
JetBlue, Southwest, United, American, and Delta implement fee waivers and rebooking options for affected travelers.
Affected flights include those at Logan Airport, with Massport advising travelers to check flight status before arriving.

title: After Cape Cod crash, readers say Mass. should tighten e-bike regulations
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: A crash on Cape Cod prompted calls for stricter e-bike regulations in Massachusetts to improve pedestrian safety.
A Boston.com survey showed 78% of readers support stronger e-bike laws, citing increased use and safety concerns.
Massachusetts currently divides e-bikes into two classes, with no license required; Class 3 bikes are unregulated.
